summary: This is a grand jury transcript from June 29, 2020, in the Southern District of New York, where an FBI Special Agent testifies about the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell. The agent details allegations from three victims (referred to as Victim 1, 2, and 3) regarding sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein with Maxwell's involvement, describes grooming tactics, properties, flight logs, and presents evidence contradicting Maxwell's prior deposition testimony.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The central subject of the grand jury investigation. Described as Epstein's romantic partner and close associate who allegedly recruited, groomed, and participated in the sexual abuse of underage girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier. Described as a multimillionaire who, with Maxwell, sexually abused underage girls at his properties in New York, Florida, and New Mexico.

persons.name: FBI Special Agent
persons.context: The testifying witness. An FBI Special Agent assigned to the Violent Crimes against Children squad who investigated Maxwell and Epstein, interviewed victims and witnesses, and participated in the search of Epstein's New York townhouse.

persons.name: Virginia Giuffre
persons.context: Referred to as 'Jane Doe 1' in the transcript. Filed a defamation lawsuit against Maxwell in 2015. Her allegations prompted the 2016 deposition where Maxwell gave testimony that is contradicted by evidence presented to the grand jury.

connections.description: Described as having a romantic relationship. Maxwell also worked for Epstein, managing his homes and staff. They acted together to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse underage girls.
The FBI Special Agent led the investigation into Maxwell's activities, interviewed victims, and presented evidence against her to the grand jury.
Maxwell was the defendant in a defamation lawsuit filed by Giuffre, which led to Maxwell giving deposition testimony in 2016 that is cited in the grand jury proceeding.

events.title: Meeting at Interlochen Summer Camp
events.description: Epstein and Maxwell meet Victim 1 (a 13/14-year-old girl) at the Interlochen Center for the Arts summer camp in Michigan. Epstein was a donor to the camp.

events.title: Grooming and Abuse of Victim 1
events.description: Victim 1 (ages 14-17) is groomed and repeatedly sexually abused by Epstein, with Maxwell's involvement, at Epstein's properties in Palm Beach and New York. Abuse includes sexualized massages, digital penetration, and use of sex toys.

events.title: Abuse of Victim 2 in New Mexico
events.description: Victim 2 (age 16) is invited to Epstein's New Mexico ranch. Maxwell instructs her to give Epstein a foot massage, gives her an inappropriate chest massage, and Epstein engages in unwanted physical contact.

events.title: Recruitment and Abuse of Victim 3 in London
events.description: Maxwell introduces 17-year-old Victim 3 to Epstein in London. During their first meeting, Maxwell instructs Victim 3 to give Epstein a massage, which leads to sexual assault by Epstein.

events.title: Palm Beach Police Search
events.description: Palm Beach Police execute a search warrant at Epstein's Florida home, seizing massage tables, sex toys, and a photograph signed by Victim 1.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Deposition (Day 1)
events.description: Maxwell gives sworn deposition testimony in Virginia Giuffre's defamation lawsuit, denying knowledge of a scheme to recruit underage girls for massages.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Deposition (Day 2)
events.description: Maxwell continues her deposition testimony, denying awareness of sex toys at Epstein's properties and knowledge of Epstein having sexual activities with anyone other than herself and two other adults.

events.title: FBI Search of Epstein's New York Townhouse
events.description: The FBI executes a search warrant at Epstein's Manhattan home, finding a massage room with sex toys, handcuffs, a whip, nude photographs, and a school-girl outfit.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's townhouse)
358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's waterfront estate)
49 Zorro Ranch Road, Stanley, New Mexico (Epstein's ranch)
Interlochen Center for the Arts, Michigan
keyFacts: An FBI agent testified that three victims (referred to as Victim 1, 2, and 3) were recruited, groomed, and sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein as minors, with Ghislaine Maxwell's direct involvement and facilitation.

Flight logs from Epstein's private jet show flights in the mid-1990s with passengers listed as 'J.E.', 'G.M.', and a person believed to be Victim 1, corroborating travel to locations where abuse occurred.
The FBI's 2019 search of Epstein's New York townhouse revealed a dedicated massage room containing sex toys, handcuffs, a whip, and a school-girl outfit, consistent with victim descriptions.

Maxwell's 2016 deposition testimony, where she denied knowledge of underage girls, sex toys, and Epstein's sexual activities with others, is directly contradicted by the evidence and victim statements presented to the grand jury.

Victims described Maxwell's role as normalizing the abuse, acting like a 'cool older sister,' giving instructions during sexualized massages, and specifically recruiting young-looking girls for Epstein.
